intro: Melanthium bracteolare, commonly known as the bracted meadowbeauty, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant features slender, erect stems that bear small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a reddish tinge along the veins. Melanthium bracteolare is typically found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
